g.text: CPU ARCHITECTURE
CPU (Central Process Unit) is the central process
unit, which is made up of different cores.
Back in the old days, the CPU used to be only
one core but now, the number is incredibly
increased reching 16, 32, 64 cores.
Each core execute one operation at a time. So,
at each timestamp, the maximum number of operations
is equal to the number of cores.
This operations are very low level operations.
This phenomana is knwon as parallelism because
given a specific instant, multiple operations
occurs.
The clock speed defines the number of operations
which each core can perform in one second. It refers
to the switch operation between 0/1 signal.
Core
Thread is one programm or a set of operations that
will happen. Each thread is assigned to one core.
Let's assume that two threads are assigned to the
same core, which is able to process only one
thread at a time. So, in order to execute both
of them, the core switch between the threads
and execute some operations of each: it's
called threading. Basically, threading means
to switch different threads in the same core.
This mechanism is also kowns as concurrent
programming which doesn't occur in parallel.
Thread
Thread
Let's suppose that we want to execute
the following lines of code:
print(1)
time.sleep(10)
print(2)
This program can be splitted into two
different threads in the same core (assuming
that there is only one core).
So, the first thread can contain
print(1) and time.sleep(), while the second
is made up of onlt the third line of code.
So, in this way, the core doesn't wait
for the time.sleep() operation but
execute the second thread.
This is a simple example but it's very effective
in game application: indeed, it's undesired
that the game screening freeze until the server
returns some data.
Some CPUs can be used as well: multi-processing.
print(1)
time.sleep()
print(2)
